author: OKFN

organization.description: A collection of data on Cambodia.
organization.title: Cambodia
organization.name: cambodia

name: cambodia-oda-database
notes:
Database of all ODA projects from donors to Cambodian Government.
## Details
The aim of the Cambodian ODA Database is to record all development finance to Cambodia from all sources, to promote the effective planning, budgeting and management of external resources, to provide public access to information on aid provided to Cambodia, and to support empirical analysis and the provision of practical policy-relevant advice.
The National Strategic Development Plan (NSDP) provides the overarching framework for implementing development activities and for programming domestic and external resources in Cambodia. In this context, and noting the obligations of both Government and development partners to the 2005 Paris Declaration on Aid Effectiveness, the Royal Government has developed its own ODA Database to promote effective aid management.

extras.value: User the query function to produce downloadable speadsheets. Site not very intuitive to navigate. Data from NGOs and government organisations (inc. UN) on two different searchable databases.
Data incomplete at times especially in yearly budgets.
Cambodian Rehabilitation and Development Board, Council for the Development of Cambodia, Government Palace, Sisowath Quay, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Tel: (855) 23 - 981 241 Fax: (855) 23 - 981 161

Official Title, Program Number, PIP Number (Govt. ref), Project Status, Development Partner, Partner Address, Co-funding, Program Objectives, Approval Date, Start Date, Completion Date, Government Institution With Whom Project Agreement Was Signed, List Of Implementing Agencies, Thematic Program, Working Group, Cambodian Government Financial Contribution, External Contribution, Total Budget, Type Of Assistance (Loan, Grant, etc.), Yearly Budget Allocation, Source Of Funding, Geographic Location Of Project, Project Personel, Paris Declaration Indicators, Contact details

The aim of the Cambodian ODA Database is to record all development finance to Cambodia from all sources, to promote the effective planning, budgeting and management of external resources, to provide public access to information on aid provided to Cambodia, and to support empirical analysis and the provision of practical policy-relevant advice. The National Strategic Development Plan (NSDP) provides the overarching framework for implementing development activities and for programming domestic and external resources in Cambodia. In this context, and noting the obligations of both Government and development partners to the 2005 Paris Declaration on Aid Effectiveness, the Royal Government has developed its own ODA Database to promote effective aid management.

ADB, Australia, Belgium, Canada, China, Denmark, EU/EC, Finland, France, Germany, Global Fund, IBRD/World Bank, IMF, Italy, Japan, Netherlands, New Zealand, Republic of Korea, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, UK, UN, USA
No information given for data licensing.
The Cambodian Rehabilitation and Development Board (CRDB) of the Council for the Development of Cambodia (CDC).
Database of all ODA projects from donors to Cambodian Government.

Chairman of CDC: Samdech HUN SEN, Prime Minister of the Royal Government of Cambodia. 1st Vice Chairman of CDC: H.E. Keat Chhon, Deputy Prime Minister. Minister of Economy and Finance. Others listed at (http://www.cdc-crdb.gov.kh/)

Health, Education, Agriculture, Manufacturing, Mining & Trade, Rural Development, Banking and Business Services, Urban Plan & Management, Information and Communications, Energy, Power and Electricity, Transportation, Water and Sanitation, Community and Social Welfare, Culture & Arts, Environment and Conservation, Gender, HIV/AIDS , Governance & Administration, Tourism, Budget & BoP Support, Emergency and food aid, Other
As each project has new data

"Data is... validated by CDC staff who are assigned portfolio responsibilities and who work closely with nominated development partner focal points." (http://www.cdc-crdb.gov.kh/database/index.htm) Government owned, but data provided by individual development partners (i.e. donors). It is not explicitly stated that this is compulsary.

title: The Cambodia ODA Database
